case.name: Maxipoint Cultivation Technologies Pty Ltd v Points Direct Pty Ltd [2009] FCA 393 (9 April 2009)

citphrases.citphrase: application to transfer proceedings from victoria district registry to western australia district registry
factors relevant to exercise of discretion to transfer
more witnesses will suffer inconvenience if proceedings remain in victoria
cause of action arose in, and subject matter principally involves, western australia

citances.sentence: In its written submissions, Buru usefully summarised the factors relevant to the exercise of the discretion as follows: the place where the cause of action arose ( National Mutual at 162); the location of parties and witnesses ( Jacobs v Claudius Enterprises Pty Ltd (1985) ATPR 40-511 at 46,078 (" Jacobs ")); the expense and prejudice likely to the respective parties ( Jacobs at 46,078); the stage of the proceedings ( National Mutual at 162 and Maxipoint Cultivation Technologies Pty Ltd v Points Direct Pty Ltd [2009] FCA 393 at [4] ); the governing law of the transactions ( Aquila Resources Limited v Pasminco Limited [2004] FCA 39 at [36] ); the existence of related proceedings which may be case managed jointly ( Wyllie Group Pty Ltd v ANZ Securities Ltd [2000] FCA 1382 at [14] - [19]); the convenience of the court ( Garrett v Macks [2009] FCA 253 at [4] ); and the balance of convenience ( Jacobs at 46,078). The Evidence
